document_data.name: Nelburn Frust
document_data.mainbody:
'''Nelburn Frust''' was an inhabitant of the city of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''"Speak thrice the phrase correctly and lucky you'll forever be." Okay, great. "Scarab scrap" - DAMMIT! Can't you see I'm trying to concentrate? "Scarab sap, scarab's cap" - oh, this is going to be harder than I thought...''|Nelburn Frust}}
document_data.Description: Nelburn was a dark-skinned [[gold dwarf]] man with a clean-shaved face, black hair, and blue eyes.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Nelburn Frust procured a [[spell]] or an incantation of dubious authenticity, presumably from the nearby [[Devil's Fee]] magic shop. Regardless of the spell and the promises of luck it could deliver, Nelburn struggled greatly with recitation.
